page.title: 05BEER QUARRY CAVES AND MUSEUM
page.content: {Beer Quarry Caves}have recently reopened. Thousands of people come to have a look at the famous limestone. The quarries are said to be nearly two thousand years old ,dating from Roman times. The cave is supported by limestone pillars. The stone was used for churches like ST.Pauls cathedral and Exeter Cathedral and Norwich Roman Catholic Cathedral. It has also been used for some famous houses. The masons preferred Beer stone because it was easy to cut and when air got to it,it hardened up. The colour of the stone is a creamy white. Beer Quarry caves were carved and dug out by hand and then the large blocks of stone were transported by horse and cart.
